questions.question: Which of the following was the world's first international health agency?

options.C: Health Organization of the League of Nations
options.D: United States Agency for International Development

questions.question: When is breastfeeding week celebrated?
questions.explanation: Breastfeeding week is celebrated in the 1st week of August.Health daysDatesWorld Tuberculosis Day24th MarchWorld Health Day7th AprilWorld Malaria DayNational Anti Malaria MonthWorld Immunization Week25th AprilJuneLast week of Apri1World No Tobacco DayWorld Blood Donor DayWorld Hepatitis DayBreastfeeding Week31st May14th June28th JulyWorld AIDS DaySexual and Reproductive Health Awareness Day1stweek of Augus1st December12th Februaryt774

questions.question: What was the theme for World Health Day 2023?
questions.explanation: The theme for World Health Day 2023 was Health for all.World Health Day is celebrated on 7th April and each year a different theme is adopted such as:2024- My health, my right• 2022- Our planet, our health• 2021- Build a fairer, healthier world for everyone, everywhere• 2020 - Support nurses and midwives.2018 & 2019 - Universal health coverage: everyone, everywhere•-2017 Depression: Let's talk•• 2016 - Beat diabetes2015 Food safetyHealth daysDatesWorld Tuberculosis Day24th MarchWorld Health Day7th April25th AprilJuneWorld Malaria DayNational Anti Malaria MonthWorld Immunization WeekWorld No Tobacco DayWorld Blood Donor DayWorld Hepatitis DayBreastfeeding WeekLast week of Apri131st May14thJune28th July1stweek of AugustWorld AIDS Day1stDecemberSexual and Reproductive Health Awareness Day12th February

questions.question: When is World No Tobacco Day observed?
questions.explanation: World No Tobacco Day is observed on 31st May.The theme of World No Tobacco Day 2021 is 'commit to quit'. It conveys that the COVID-19pandemic has led to millions of tobacco users saying they want to quit.The theme of World No Tobacco Day 2020 was #TobaccoExposed. It aimed to provide acounter-marketing campaign that shows smokers have a higher risk of getting a severe case ofCOVID-19 and to empower young people to engage in the fight against tobacco.775

questions.question: What was the theme of World TB Day 2023?

options.C: Invest to End TB. Save Lives

questions.explanation: The theme of world TB day 2023 was 'Yes! We can end TB!'.World Tuberculosis Day is observed on 24th March of every year.The themes for the other world TB days are:The theme of 2024 continues to be, 'Yes! We can end TB!'2022: Invest to End TB. Save Lives2021: The clock is ticking2020: It's time to End TB2019: It's time for action2018: Wanted: Leaders for a TB-free world

questions.question: Where is the headquarters of the WHO located?
questions.explanation: The headquarters of the WHO is in Geneva, Switzerland.The WHO is a specialized, non-political health agency of the United Nations. It came into force on7th April 1948.Its objective is the attainment of the highest level of health by all people. The structure of theWHO includes:• The World Health Assembly•The Executive Board• The SecretariatImportant headquarters of international organisations include:• The headquarters of UNICEF and UNDP is in New York, USA.• Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) headquarters is in Rome, Italy.• Headquarters of the International Labor Organization (ILO) and the International Red Cross arealso in Geneva.The image below shows the WHO emblem.776World HealthOrganization

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the duties of the WHO?
questions.explanation: State health is not one of the duties of the WHO. It is the responsibility of the government.Work and duties of the WHO:• Prevention and control of specific diseases• Development of comprehensive health services• Family health• Environmental health•Health statistics• Biomedical research• Health literature and information• Cooperation with other organizations

questions.question: Where is the South East Asian Regional Office of the WHO located?
questions.explanation: The South-East Asian Regional Office (SEARO) of the WHO is located in New Delhi. Duties of theSEARO include planning for malaria eradication, tuberculosis control, and rural health services.Members of SEARO are:•• Bangladesh• India•⚫ Bhutan• Indonesia777• Democratic People's Republic of Korea• The Republic of Maldives•MyanmarNepal•Sri Lanka• Thailand• Timor-LesteThe regional offices of the WHO are listed below.Regional officeLocationSouth-East Asian officeAfrican regional officeAmerican regional officeEuropean regional head officeNew Delhi, IndiaBrazzaville, Republic of CongWashington D. C., USACopenhagen, DenmarkEastern Mediterranean officeWestern Pacific regional officAlexandria, EgyptManila, Philippines

questions.question: What is the surveillance reporting system used by the WHO?
questions.explanation: The surveillance reporting system used by the WHO is the Weekly Epidemiological Record(WER).The WHO collects and disseminates epidemiological information on diseases subject toInternational Health Regulations. It is done through an Automatic Telex Reply Service (ATRS)and the Weekly Epidemiological Record (WER).

questions.question: As a part of the 'Clean care is safer care' campaign, you have been asked to give a presentationto the nurses in the obstetrics and gynecology department. Which of the following areas istargeted in this campaign?
questions.explanation: 'Clean care is safer care' campaign was started by the WHO to improve hand hygiene practices.In 2005, WHO developed this campaign aimed at the reduction of healthcare-associatedinfections (HCAI) through the worldwide promotion of appropriate hand hygiene practices.

questions.question: Which agency of the United Nations has the given logo?768
questions.explanation: 778The given logo is that of the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF). It works closely with theWHO on health matters.UNICEF's content of services include:• Child health• Child nutrition•• Family and child welfare• Formal and informal educationUNICEF participates in urban basic services (UBS) with the aim to promote access to basicservices like nutrition, water supply, and sanitation.UNICEF started the Baby-Friendly Hospital Initiative (BFHI) to promote breastfeeding andimprove maternal and child care. In 2016, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare launchedthe Mothers Absolute Affection (MAA) programme to revitalize efforts towards protection,promotion and support of breastfeeding practices.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of UNICEF's GOBI FFF strategy?
questions.explanation: The components of the GOBI FFF strategy by the UNICEF are:• Growth monitoring with growth charts• Oral rehydration therapy for diarrhoea and dehydration.⚫ Breastfeeding• Immunization of children• Family planning and birth spacing• Food supplementation•Female literacy promotionThe GOBI FFF strategy is aimed at revolutionising child health and survival. Initially, it was calledGOBI strategy and later the FFF aspect was added to it.

questions.question: Which agency of the UN gives funds for technical assistance and has the following as part ofits logo?
questions.explanation: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is an agency of the UN that gives funds fortechnical assistance. It has the following logo.779•BNPIts main objective is to help poorer nations develop their human and natural resources to theirpotential.Some other agencies of the UN include:• UNESCO - United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization• UNEP - United Nations Environment Programme⚫ UNHCR - United Nations High Commissioner for RefugeesTheir logos are given below.UNESCO780UNEPUNHCRThe UN Refugee Agency

questions.question: Which organisation gives the highest funding for reproductive health?
questions.explanation: United Nations Fund for Population Activities (UNFPA) gives the highest funding for reproductivehealth. It works in the area of health and family welfare.It mainly works by:• Developing the national capability in manufacturing contraceptives,• Promoting population education programmes• Introducing innovative approaches to family planning and MCH care.Sexual and Reproductive Health Awareness Day is organized on February 12th every year to raiseawareness about sexual and reproductive health.The logo of the UNFPA is given below.781UNFPA

questions.question: Which of the following is not an objective of the FAO?

options.A: To better the condition of rural people
options.B: Improve nutrition of people of all countries

questions.explanation: Improving access to nutritious foods is not one of the objectives of the FAO.Aims of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO):• To help nations raise living standards• To improve the nutrition of people of all countries• To increase the efficiency of farming, forestry, and fisheries•To better the condition of rural peopleThe FAO organized a Freedom from Hunger Campaign (FFHC) in 1960. Its main objective was tocombat malnutrition and to disseminate information and education.The FAO logo is given below.FAFIAT782PANIS

questions.question: Which agency of the United Nations has the following logo?

options.C: United States Agency for International Development770

questions.explanation: The given logo is of the World Bank.It helps less developed countries raise their living standards with economic support. Theallocation of funds is decided by its Board of Governors.

questions.question: What does the branch of medicine known as nosology deal with?
questions.explanation: Nosology is the branch of medicine that deals with the classification of diseases.

questions.question: Study of which of the following is known as emporiatrics?
questions.explanation: Emporiatrics is the study of the health of travelers.It is also called travel medicine. It deals with the prevention and management of health problemsof international travelers.

questions.question: Quarantine measures were implemented for the first time to prevent the spread of:
questions.explanation: Quarantine was introduced for the first time to prevent the spread of the plague, also known asthe black death.Quarantine is the restriction on the movement of people, animals, and goods that may have beenexposed to a communicable disease. It is intended to prevent the spread of communicablediseases.Quarantine is distinct from medical isolation, in which those confirmed to be infected with acommunicable disease are isolated from the healthy population.

questions.question: Which of the following is not included in the Special Programme for Research and Training inTropical Disease (TDR) strategy of the WHO?
questions.explanation: Tick-borne encephalitis is not included in the Special Programme for Research and Training inTropical Disease (TDR) strategy of the WHO. The diseases included under this programme are:Chagas disease•• Dengue⚫ Ebola• Helminthiasis783• Leishmaniasis• Leprosy• Lymphatic filariasis• Malaria•Onchocerciasis• Schistosomiasis•Trypanosomiasis• TuberculosisThe programme is sponsored by the WHO, UNICEF, UNDP, and World Bank.

questions.question: According to the International Health Regulations, on diagnosing a patient with which of thefollowing diseases is notification not mandatory in all countries?
questions.explanation: According to the International Health Regulations (IHR), notification is not mandatory if a patientis diagnosed with tuberculosis in all countries.It needs to be notified only by the countries where the public health impact is serious and there isa risk of international spread.The government of India made the reporting of new cases of TB mandatory for all medicalpractitioners from 2012. An online web-based application named Nikshay is available for thispurpose. Treatment providers are given a nominal cash incentive of Rs.1000/- per TB patientreported.

questions.question: Which of the following disease is not under international surveillance by the WHO?
questions.explanation: Chagas disease is not under international surveillance by the WHO.Surveillance is usually done for infectious diseases and diseases that have the potential to becomeepidemics or pandemics.

questions.question: Patients with which of the following diseases do not require isolation or quarantine?
questions.explanation: Patients with West Nile fever do not require isolation or quarantine.Isolation and quarantine are used for highly infectious diseases that are at risk ofbecoming epidemics or pandemics.

questions.question: You are asked to investigate a possible act of terrorism using anthrax. Which of the followingis false regarding this category of bioterrorism agent?
questions.explanation: 784Anthrax falls under category A of bioterrorism agents. These organisms are usually easy todisseminate.Category A refers to high priority agents. They have high case-fatality rates and hightransmissibility. Thus, a specialised public health response is required to combat such attacks.

questions.question: How many goals does the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) comprise of?
questions.explanation: The Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) are comprised of 17 goals.These were set as part of the official Sustainable Development Goals of the Agenda 2030. Thesegoals consist of a total of 169 targets. SDGs replaced the Millennium Development Goals on 1stJanuary 2016.The 2030 agenda consists of five P's:• People•Planet• Prosperity• Peace• PartnershipSUSTAINABLEDEVELOPMENT GOALS1 POVERTYZERO2 HUNGERSSS3 GOOD HEALTHAND WELL-BEING4 EDUCATIONQUALITY5GENDEREQUALITY6CLEAN WATERAND SANITATIONAFFORDABLE ANDCLEAN ENERGY8 ECONOMIC GROWTHECONOMIC GROWTHMINDUSTRY, INNOVATION9 INFRASTRUCTUREREDUCED10 INEQUALITIESSUSTAINABLE CITIESAND COMMUNITIESRESPONSIBLE12 CONSUMPTIONAND PRODUCTIONQO13CLIMATEACTIONLIFE14 BELOW WATER15 LIFEON LANDPEACE, JUSTICE16 AND STRONGINSTITUTIONS17PARTNERSHIPSFOR THE GOALS785
